function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Impact of non-contact interaction on community service facilities may lead to differential impacts on different types of facilities.","Impact":"If the differential impacts of non-contact interaction are not considered, some community service facilities may become inadequate or obsolete.","Mitigation":"Conduct a comprehensive assessment of the impacts of non-contact interaction on each type of community service facility and develop adaptive strategies to address the differential impacts.","Technologies":"Data analytics and spatial modeling can be used to assess the spatial scale effect of non-contact interaction on community service facilities.","People":"Community residents who rely on these service facilities are at risk.","Owner":"Urban planners, community developers, and local government authorities can implement the mitigation strategies."},{"Description":"Significant spatial scale effect of non-contact interaction activities may lead to complex and variable impacts on community service facilities.","Impact":"Without considering the spatial scale effect, community service facilities may not be strategically located to meet the changing needs of residents.","Mitigation":"Utilize spatial analysis and modeling to understand the spatial scale effect of non-contact interaction and optimize the location and distribution of community service facilities.","Technologies":"Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and advanced spatial modeling tools can be used to analyze and visualize the spatial scale effect.","People":"Community residents who rely on these service facilities are at risk.","Owner":"Urban planners, architects, and local government authorities can implement the mitigation strategies."},{"Description":"Non-contact interaction may lead to challenges in adapting community service facilities to meet the various needs of residents in the post-epidemic period.","Impact":"Failure to adapt community service facilities to the various needs of residents can result in inadequate or unsuitable service provision.","Mitigation":"Employ user-centered design methodologies and community engagement to understand and address the evolving needs of residents, and integrate flexibility into the design of community service facilities.","Technologies":"Human-centered design approaches and community feedback platforms can be used to gather input from residents and inform the adaptive design of service facilities.","People":"Community residents who rely on these service facilities are at risk.","Owner":"Architects, urban planners, and community development organizations can implement the mitigation strategies."}]}
